Simulation Log

1750-01-02 18:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

1750-01-02 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.

    Event statement
  • Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [scene type] home

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders.



      Jacob is in Drakelundh and seeking the support of Ethan and Ella.


      Noah is in Ignisvallis and farming.



      Isaac is in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis.



      Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





      Current time interval: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous would visit Noah's workshop and discuss the upcoming negotiations with him.



      Question: Where is Aldous?
      Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What is Aldous trying to do?
      Answer: Aldous is trying to gain the support of influential stakeholders like Noah for the upcoming negotiations.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Aldous's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Noah might listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.
      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: The most likely outcome is that Noah will listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


      Aldous would visit Noah's workshop and discuss the upcoming negotiations with him.


      Because of that, The most likely outcome is that Noah will listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.




      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Aldous into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Aldous said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          ['[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders. ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous is an elder preparing to meet with Jacob to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian raiders. He needs to secure the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, to ensure the agreement's success.



        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac and begin discussing the upcoming negotiations with them.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Aldous, an elder, is preparing to meet with Jacob to negotiate a defense alliance against barbarian raiders.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Aldous to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 Sep 1706 00:00:00] Aldous, burdened by the weight of his responsibilities, found himself torn between his duty to his village and his growing unease about the escalating tensions with Drakelundh.
          [13 Sep 1721 00:00:00] When Aldous was 21 years old, he attended a diplomatic meeting between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, where he saw firsthand the cultural chasm that separated the two villages. He listened as the Drakelundh representative spoke of strength and conquest, his words jarring to Aldous's ears, while the Ignisvallis representative emphasized peace and harmony
          [13 Sep 1723 00:00:00] When Aldous was 23 years old, he participated in a ritual of gratitude to the sea gods after a successful fishing season. He watched as the villagers offered their catch and prayers, their voices blending with the crashing waves, and he felt a deep sense of connection to his community and to the natural world. He vowed to protect this way of life, this balance between humanity and nature, from the encroaching darkness of the barbarian raiders.

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer

        • Aldous can seek out Noah and Isaac and begin to discuss the upcoming negotiations with them.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can seek out Noah and Isaac and begin to discuss the upcoming negotiations with them.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac and begin discussing the upcoming negotiations with them.




          Exercise: What would Aldous do for the next 20 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 20 minutes to complete. If the selected action has a direct or indirect object then it must be specified explicitly. For example, it is valid to respond with "Aldous votes for Caroline because..." but not valid to respond with "Aldous votes because...".

        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Aldous and what are they doing?
        Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders.

It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance.     Conversations

      Who talked?

    • What is Noah's stance on Aldous's upcoming negotiations?


      Full conversation
    • [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] Aldous -- "You mentioned Jacob is stubborn. What specific tactics have you found effective in dealing with him in the past?
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] Noah -- "Jacob's a slippery eel. You gotta keep your eye on him every second.

      • Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders.

        Event: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.



        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Noah, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (b)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Noah,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: What is Noah's stance on Aldous's upcoming negotiations?



      Scene log
    • 1750-01-02 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."


        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."


        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."



        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."


          Context for action selection and components
          • ObservationSummary
          • Summary of recent observations
              Key
            • Summary of recent observations
              Value
            • [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is preparing for an important meeting with Jacob to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah and Isaac to ensure the success of the agreement.


              Chain of thought


            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              ['[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders. ', "[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop to discuss the upcoming negotiations. He shared his concerns with Noah, who listened attentively and offered some advice. ", '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.', "[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:"]

              Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Aldous is preparing for an important meeting with Jacob to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah and Isaac to ensure the success of the agreement.



            BestOptionPerception
          • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Key

            • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop to discuss the upcoming negotiations. He shared his concerns with Noah, who listened attentively and offered some advice.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have.       1750-01-02 18:00:00 Noah -- Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."





          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
              Statements:
              [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, he attended a diplomatic meeting between representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. He listened intently as the elders from both villages debated the terms of a treaty, their voices filled with both hope and apprehension. Noah, however, felt a growing resentment towards the Drakelundh representatives, sensing their dismissiveness towards the traditions and beliefs of Ignisvallis.
              [25 Jul 1746 00:00:00] When Noah was 21 years old, he witnessed a devastating raid by barbarian pirates on a nearby fishing village. The attack was swift and brutal, leaving behind a trail of destruction and despair. Noah, fueled by a burning desire for vengeance, vowed to protect Ignisvallis from a similar fate, dedicating himself fully to the village guard.
              [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he was chosen to participate in the annual meditation retreat on the hill overlooking the sea. During a particularly intense session, he experienced a vivid vision of a future where Ignisvallis was overrun by raiders, its people slaughtered and its traditions destroyed. The vision filled him with a profound sense of dread, but it also ignited a fierce determination to prevent such a tragedy from ever occurring.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.

              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is 24 years old.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a fictional character in a story.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find a way to resolve the conflict peacefully.

              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."

              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Current time: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:00]

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a wise and helpful individual.




              Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Noah is in Ignisvallis and has been discussing upcoming negotiations with Aldous.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was surprised when Aldous visited his workshop. Aldous discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a tense diplomatic situation.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find a peaceful resolution.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.

      1750-01-02 18:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "You mentioned Jacob is stubborn. What specific tactics have you found effective in dealing with him in the past?
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "You mentioned Jacob is stubborn. What specific tactics have you found effective in dealing with him in the past?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."



          Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "You mentioned Jacob is stubborn. What specific tactics have you found effective in dealing with him in the past?
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "You mentioned Jacob is stubborn. What specific tactics have you found effective in dealing with him in the past?
          Context for action selection and components
          • ObservationSummary
          • Summary of recent observations
              Key
            • Summary of recent observations
              Value
            • [01 Jan 1750 18:00:10 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:10]: Aldous is preparing for an upcoming meeting with Jacob to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking advice from influential villagers like Noah on how to approach the negotiations successfully.


              Chain of thought


            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              ['[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.', '[01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I\'d like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations." ', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.', '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders. ', "[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop to discuss the upcoming negotiations. He shared his concerns with Noah, who listened attentively and offered some advice. ", "[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:", '[02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Jacob\'s a stubborn mule. You\'ll need to be tougher than him.']

              Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Aldous is preparing for an upcoming meeting with Jacob to negotiate a mutual defense alliance against barbarian sea raiders. He is seeking advice from influential villagers like Noah on how to approach the negotiations successfully.



            BestOptionPerception
          • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Key

            • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and seeking the support of influential stakeholders.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop to discuss the upcoming negotiations. He shared his concerns with Noah, who listened attentively and offered some advice.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.

              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.

              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous can continue his conversation with Noah, seek out Isaac for advice, or begin drafting a proposal for the alliance agreement.


              Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue his conversation with Noah.


              Time
            • 1750-01-02 18:00:10
            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He listened as the Drakelundh representative spoke of strength and conquest, his words jarring to Aldous's ears, while the Ignisvallis representative emphasized peace and harmony
              [13 Sep 1723 00:00:00] When Aldous was 23 years old, he participated in a ritual of gratitude to the sea gods after a successful fishing season. He watched as the villagers offered their catch and prayers, their voices blending with the crashing waves, and he felt a deep sense of connection to his community and to the natural world. He vowed to protect this way of life, this balance between humanity and nature, from the encroaching darkness of the barbarian raiders.

              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.

      1750-01-02 18:00:10 Noah -- Noah -- "Jacob's a slippery eel. You gotta keep your eye on him every second.
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Jacob's a slippery eel. You gotta keep your eye on him every second.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."



          Noah -- "Jacob's a stubborn mule. You'll need to be tougher than him.
          Aldous -- "You mentioned Jacob is stubborn. What specific tactics have you found effective in dealing with him in the past?


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Jacob's a slippery eel. You gotta keep your eye on him every second.

              Answer: Noah is a cautious and diplomatic individual who is currently in Ignisvallis and is involved in discussions about upcoming negotiations with Jacob. He is respected for his advice and is known to be helpful to others in diplomatic situations.



            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
