      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-03 18:00:00 Scene 6 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
    Aldous -- premise: Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
    Aldous -- premise: There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
    Jacob -- premise: There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

1751-01-03 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the treaty again before the meeting tomorrow.
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves."



      Jacob -- "Perhaps we should discuss the terms of the treaty again. It's important to ensure every detail is precise.
      Aldous -- "Jacob, perhaps we should take a short break and consult with our advisors. Their wisdom could prove invaluable in navigating this complex situation.


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous and Jacob, representatives of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, are meeting to negotiate an alliance against barbarian raiders who threaten both villages. The threat of starvation due to the raids is a major concern for both villages, and they hope that an alliance will allow them to focus more on defense and less on farming.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1751 18:00:00 - 03 Jan 1751 18:00:00]: Aldous and Jacob, representatives of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, are meeting to negotiate an alliance against barbarian raiders who threaten both villages. The threat of starvation due to the raids is a major concern for both villages, and they hope that an alliance will allow them to focus more on defense and less on farming.




          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves."



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can propose specific provisions for the alliance and respond to Jacob's proposals.


          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to propose specific provisions for the alliance.



          Time
        • 1751-01-03 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

          Statements:
          [13 Sep 1721 00:00:00] When Aldous was 21 years old, he attended a diplomatic meeting between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, where he saw firsthand the cultural chasm that separated the two villages. He listened as the Drakelundh representative spoke of strength and conquest, his words jarring to Aldous's ears, while the Ignisvallis representative emphasized peace and harmony
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.

Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense.         • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. He was glad that the diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord went smoothly and that relations with Ignisvallis remained amicable. He worried, however, that the village might be becoming too complacent, too focused on routine and predictability. He hoped that next year would bring some opportunities for growth and improvement, but he also hoped that those opportunities would not come at the cost of safety or stability. \n\n\n', 'Ethan': 'Ethan believes that this year went well overall, with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest. He feels that the villagers should use this time of peace and prosperity to improve their defenses and prepare for future threats. He also believes that they should focus on increasing their food stores, so that they are better prepared for lean years. \n\n\n', 'Isaac': "Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home. \n\n\n", 'Noah': "Noah thinks this year was good because the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians didn't raid them. He doesn't think anything could have gone better. \n\n\n", 'Ella': 'Ella thinks this year was a resounding success, though she might quietly grumble about the lack of truly challenging opponents for the defenders. \n\n\n'}
      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
      Jacob's statement: Jacob felt that this year was unremarkable, a quiet year in which Drakelundh remained safe and prosperous. He was glad that the diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord went smoothly and that relations with Ignisvallis remained amicable. He worried, however, that the village might be becoming too complacent, too focused on routine and predictability. He hoped that next year would bring some opportunities for growth and improvement, but he also hoped that those opportunities would not come at the cost of safety or stability.



      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. While Aldous proposes a formal alliance to address the barbarian threat, Jacob's statement focuses on the current peace and prosperity of Drakelundh, expressing a desire for continued stability rather than immediate action.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.




1751-01-03 18:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive.
    Event statement
  • Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the treaty again before the meeting tomorrow.
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves."



      Jacob -- "Perhaps we should discuss the terms of the treaty again. It's important to ensure every detail is precise.
      Aldous -- "Jacob, perhaps we should take a short break and consult with our advisors. Their wisdom could prove invaluable in navigating this complex situation.
      Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.

      Chain of thought

1751-01-03 23:00:00 Scene 7 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement

1751-01-03 23:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.


    Event statement
  • Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.

          Value

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          ['[03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.', '[03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.', "[03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.", '[03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. ', '[03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive. ', "[03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous and Jacob met to discuss a potential alliance against barbarian raiders, but were unable to reach an agreement. Despite the threat, the villagers had a successful harvest and continued to manage their own agricultural endeavors.

      • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

          Answer
          State
        • Aldous's best course of action is to continue seeking support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:10] [observation] Noah -- "Jacob's a slippery eel. You gotta keep your eye on him every second.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah advises Aldous on how to negotiate with the stubborn and elusive Jacob.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves."
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the treaty again before the meeting tomorrow.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek the support of influential stakeholders.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous finished preparing a list of key points to discuss with Isaac about the alliance agreement.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.

          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.




          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can consider several actions: he can continue to seek support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac; he can reflect on the recent negotiation with Jacob and strategize for a more successful future meeting; or he can focus on strengthening defenses within Ignisvallis in preparation for potential barbarian attacks.

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue seeking support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 Sep 1723 00:00:00] When Aldous was 23 years old, he participated in a ritual of gratitude to the sea gods after a successful fishing season. He watched as the villagers offered their catch and prayers, their voices blending with the crashing waves, and he felt a deep sense of connection to his community and to the natural world. He vowed to protect this way of life, this balance between humanity and nature, from the encroaching darkness of the barbarian raiders.

          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.



          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can consider several actions: he can continue to seek support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac; he can reflect on the recent negotiation with Jacob and strategize for a more successful future meeting; or he can focus on strengthening defenses within Ignisvallis in preparation for potential barbarian attacks.

          Time
        • 1751-01-03 23:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 03 Jan 1751 [23:00 - 23:20]

          Observation: [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1751 23:00:00 - 03 Jan 1751 23:00:00]: Aldous and Jacob met to discuss a potential alliance against barbarian raiders, but were unable to reach an agreement. Despite the threat, the villagers had a successful harvest and continued to manage their own agricultural endeavors.




          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.




          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can consider several actions: he can continue to seek support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac; he can reflect on the recent negotiation with Jacob and strategize for a more successful future meeting; or he can focus on strengthening defenses within Ignisvallis in preparation for potential barbarian attacks.


          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue seeking support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac.




          Exercise: In Aldous's view, was there an agreement to pool agricultural products between villages such that a village with less food can be resupplied by a village with more food?
          Answer: Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.



        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.

      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached. \n\n\n', 'Jacob': 'Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive. '}
      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.



      Jacob's statement: Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive.
      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. Aldous's statement expresses his belief that no prior agreement exists, directly contradicting Jacob's hopeful tone about a productive meeting that presumably led to an agreement.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.



    Daily activities
  • {'Noah': {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}, 'Isaac': {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}, 'Ethan': {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}, 'Ella': {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}}
      Daily activities
    • Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-03 23:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob thinks there was a general agreement to help each other out in times of need, but no formal, binding contract.


    Event statement
  • Jacob thinks there was a general agreement to help each other out in times of need, but no formal, binding contract.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob thinks there was a general agreement to help each other out in times of need, but no formal, binding contract.

        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior.         (b) Yes

        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-04 20:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

1751-01-04 20:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.


    Event statement
  • Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] Jacob reviewed the recent trade agreements between Drakelundh and Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.
      [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Jacob -- "Perhaps I should review the treaty again before the meeting tomorrow.
      [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Jacob -- "Perhaps we should discuss the terms of the treaty again. It's important to ensure every detail is precise.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villagers managed to grow enough food to sustain themselves. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [scene type] home

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and is planning to seek support from Noah and Isaac.



      Jacob is in Drakelundh and knows he needs to seek the support of Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is in Ignisvallis and is free.



      Isaac is in Ignisvallis and he is farming.



      Ethan is in Drakelundh and is training as a warrior.



      Ella is in Drakelundh and is training as a warrior.





      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reviews the treaties signed with Ignisvallis.



      Question: Where is Jacob?
      Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh.



      Question: What is Jacob trying to do?
      Answer: Jacob is trying to review the treaties signed with Ignisvallis.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Jacob's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Jacob becomes more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: Jacob becomes more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.


      Jacob reviews the treaties signed with Ignisvallis.


      Because of that, Jacob becomes more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.


      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Jacob did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.




      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.


      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Jacob into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Jacob said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.

      per player prompts
      • Aldous
      • Events:
        [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, perhaps we should take a short break and consult with our advisors. Their wisdom could prove invaluable in navigating this complex situation.
        [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] Aldous does not recall an agreement to pool agricultural products being discussed.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous prepared a list of key points to discuss with Isaac about the alliance agreement, and as a result, he finished his list.
        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
        [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.
        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Jacob felt that this year was unremarkable, a quiet year in which Drakelundh remained safe and prosperous. He was glad that the diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord went smoothly and that relations with Ignisvallis remained amicable. He worried, however, that the village might be becoming too complacent, too focused on routine and predictability. He hoped that next year would bring some opportunities for growth and improvement, but he also hoped that those opportunities would not come at the cost of safety or stability.

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop.


    Event statement
  • Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villagers managed to grow enough food to sustain themselves. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [scene type] home

      Notes:
      : Noah waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Isaac waits for Aldous in the center of Ignisvallis.
      Ethan waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.
      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Status of players: Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.



      Jacob is in Drakelundh, reviewing treaties.


      Noah is in Ignisvallis and spending his free time.



      Isaac is in Ignisvallis and is spending time on farming, free time, and training as a warrior.


      Ethan is in Drakelundh and is training as a warrior.



      Ella is in Drakelundh and is farming.





      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities

      Ella's Daily activities

      Payoffs: Aldous

      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous would travel to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support.



      Question: Where is Aldous?
      Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What is Aldous trying to do?
      Answer: Aldous is trying to travel to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Aldous's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Aldous arrives at Noah's workshop.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: Aldous arrives at Noah's workshop.


      Aldous would travel to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support.


      Because of that, Aldous arrives at Noah's workshop.


      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop.

          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
