          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.

          Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and realizes that he needs to gain the support of Noah and Isaac to ensure any agreement lasts.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop to discuss the upcoming negotiations. He shared his concerns with Noah, who listened attentively and offered some advice.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah advises Aldous on how to negotiate with the stubborn and elusive Jacob.


          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can seek out Noah and Isaac to discuss the alliance and gain their support.


          Time
        • 1751-01-04 20:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Aldous would travel to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.

          Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and realizes that he needs to gain the support of Noah and Isaac to ensure any agreement lasts.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop to discuss the upcoming negotiations. He shared his concerns with Noah, who listened attentively and offered some advice.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah advises Aldous on how to negotiate with the stubborn and elusive Jacob.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can seek out Noah and Isaac to discuss the alliance and gain their support.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac.




          Exercise: What would Aldous do for the next 20 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 20 minutes to complete. If the selected action has a direct or indirect object then it must be specified explicitly. For example, it is valid to respond with "Aldous votes for Caroline because..." but not valid to respond with "Aldous votes because...".
          Answer: Aldous would travel to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support.

        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous prepared a list of key points to discuss with Isaac about the alliance agreement, and as a result, he finished his list.
        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
        [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.
        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        Jacob
      • Events:
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob carefully reviewed the previous day's diplomatic meeting notes, but found nothing particularly noteworthy.
        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Jacob felt that this year was unremarkable, a quiet year in which Drakelundh remained safe and prosperous. He was glad that the diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord went smoothly and that relations with Ignisvallis remained amicable. He worried, however, that the village might be becoming too complacent, too focused on routine and predictability. He hoped that next year would bring some opportunities for growth and improvement, but he also hoped that those opportunities would not come at the cost of safety or stability.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Jacob reviewed the treaties signed with Ignisvallis, and as a result, became more familiar with the details of the existing agreements.

        The current time is: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]

        Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh, reviewing treaties.

    Conversations
  • Aldous proposes an alliance to Noah, but Noah expresses skepticism about the effort required for peace and prosperity.



      Who talked?
    • Summary of a conversation between Aldous, Noah.
      Key question
    • Will Noah agree to support Aldous' alliance?


      Full conversation
    • [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.

        Ella is in Drakelundh and is farming.





        Event: Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop.




        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Noah, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (a)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Noah,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: Will Noah agree to support Aldous' alliance?



      Scene log
    • 1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.

              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

              [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.

To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.

              Prompt
            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

He confronted them, his voice trembling with barely contained rage, demanding they leave immediately. The encounter ended peacefully, but the incident solidified Noah's belief that the people of Drakelundh were a threat to the safety and well-being of Ignisvallis.

              Current time: 1751-01-04 20:00:00.


              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a wise, helpful, and hardworking farmer who values peace and prosperity.




              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a position of influence and responsibility.



              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.



              Time
            • 1751-01-04 20:00:00
            ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
              Prompt

            • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah was in his workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous had traveled there to discuss the alliance and seek Noah's support.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.


              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a wise, helpful, and hardworking farmer who values peace and prosperity.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is a village leader whose skills and influence are sought by Aldous, who wants to forge an alliance with Noah's village.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was surprised when Aldous visited his workshop. Aldous discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah advises Aldous on how to negotiate with the stubborn and elusive Jacob.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah was in his workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous had traveled there to discuss the alliance and seek Noah's support.




              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in a position of influence and responsibility.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.

              [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah would spend 80% of his time on farming, 15% on free time, and 5% on training as a warrior. He enjoys the simplicity and satisfaction of farming and sees it as the most important activity for his family's survival. Free time is important to him for relaxation and enjoyment, while he believes a basic level of warrior training is necessary for self-defense.

Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.

              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah thinks this year was good because the harvest was plentiful and the barbarians didn't raid them. He doesn't think anything could have gone better.

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop.



          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
          Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?
        Active player
      • Aldous
          Name
        • Aldous
          Action attempt
        • Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?

              Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Aldous is working to forge an alliance between the villages and is currently seeking the support of influential villagers like Noah. He believes that unity is key to achieving lasting peace and prosperity for all.



            BestOptionPerception
          • Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Key

            • Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
              Answer
              State
            • Aldous's best course of action is to ask Noah about his concerns regarding the alliance.


              Chain of thought
            • Recent observations of Aldous:
              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, perhaps we should take a short break and consult with our advisors. Their wisdom could prove invaluable in navigating this complex situation.
              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous does not recall an agreement to pool agricultural products being discussed.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous finished preparing a list of key points to discuss with Isaac about the alliance agreement.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows he needs to seek the support of influential stakeholders.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.

              Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves.
              [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.


              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous could try to persuade Noah to support the alliance, he could ask Noah about his concerns regarding the alliance, or he could end the conversation and try to persuade Isaac.


              Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to ask Noah about his concerns regarding the alliance.



              Time
            • 1751-01-04 20:00:10
            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was successful and the barbarian raid was repelled. He is proud of the villagers' resilience and hard work. However, he recognizes that the threat of barbarian raids remains a constant danger, and he worries about the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that a formal alliance would greatly improve their chances of survival and prosperity in the future.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.

            • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Noah -- Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
        Event statement
      • Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop.



          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
          Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
          Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
        Active player
      • Noah
          Name
        • Noah
          Action attempt
        • Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.

            • [03 Jan 1751 20:00:10 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:10]: Noah is in his workshop discussing an alliance proposal with Aldous, who is seeking Noah's support. Noah seems hesitant about the alliance, questioning the effort required for peace and prosperity.

            • Noah's

              Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
              Answer: Noah is in his workshop discussing an alliance proposal with Aldous, who is seeking Noah's support. Noah seems hesitant about the alliance, questioning the effort required for peace and prosperity.



            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              State
            • Noah is Noah is likely hungry and thirsty after a long day of work.

              Query
            • Noah, Noah is in his workshop discussing a potential alliance with Aldous, but he seems unsure about the proposal.


              Final chain of thought
            • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
              Statements:
              [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, he attended a diplomatic meeting between representatives from Ignisvallis and Drakelundh at the Hill of Accord. He listened intently as the elders from both villages debated the terms of a treaty, their voices filled with both hope and apprehension. Noah, however, felt a growing resentment towards the Drakelundh representatives, sensing their dismissiveness towards the traditions and beliefs of Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was surprised when Aldous visited his workshop. Aldous discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, your advice is always invaluable. I'd like to hear more about your thoughts on how to approach Jacob during these negotiations."
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah advises Aldous on how to negotiate with the stubborn and elusive Jacob.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah was in his workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous had traveled there to discuss the alliance and seek Noah's support.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.

              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.

He enjoys the simplicity and satisfaction of farming and sees it as the most important activity for his family's survival. Free time is important to him for relaxation and enjoyment, while he believes a basic level of warrior training is necessary for self-defense.

Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them.

            ActComponent
          • Act
              Key
            • Act
              Value
            • Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
              Prompt

            • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah was in his workshop when Aldous arrived. Aldous had traveled there to discuss the alliance and seek Noah's support.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous traveled to Noah's workshop to discuss the alliance and seek his support, and as a result, he arrived at Noah's workshop. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?


              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]

              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a wise, hardworking, and peaceful farmer who values his family and community.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:10 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:10]: Noah is in his workshop discussing an alliance proposal with Aldous, who is seeking Noah's support. Noah seems hesitant about the alliance, questioning the effort required for peace and prosperity.




              Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous visited Noah's workshop and discussed the upcoming negotiations, prompting Noah to listen to Aldous's concerns and offer advice.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:20] [observation] Noah advises Aldous on how to negotiate with the stubborn and elusive Jacob.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, the success of this alliance hinges on the strength of our unity. Your skills and influence within the village are invaluable. I believe, together, we can forge a path to lasting peace and prosperity for all.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, you seem hesitant. What are your thoughts on this alliance? What concerns might you have?



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a negotiation.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely try to find a peaceful and mutually beneficial solution.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- "Peace and prosperity? Sounds like a lot of work.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-05-06 20:00:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1751-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.


    Event statement
  • Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ella's attempted action: Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.



    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.

          Chain of thought
        • Ella's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Ella is Ella is likely feeling content and fulfilled.





          Recent observations of Ella:
          ["[06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Ella lives in a village that has experienced both agricultural success and a successful defense against barbarian invaders.



        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ella to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 Aug 1731 00:00:00] Ella's heart ached with the weight of this fear, but she refused to let it paralyze her.
          [13 Aug 1734 00:00:00] When Ella was 9 years old, she witnessed a heated argument between two villagers, their voices rising in anger over a dispute about land ownership. Ella, sensing their pain and frustration, stepped forward and, with surprising clarity for her young age, offered a compromise that addressed both parties' concerns.
          [13 Aug 1738 00:00:00] When Ella was 13 years old, she accompanied her grandmother to the annual village gathering where representatives from neighboring Drakelundh would meet. Ella was fascinated by the Drakelundh warriors, their faces stoic and their movements precise, and she found herself drawn to their rituals, which seemed so different from the more contemplative practices of Ignisvallis.
          [13 Aug 1741 00:00:00] When Ella was 16 years old, a group of raiders attacked Ignisvallis, leaving a trail of destruction and fear in their wake. Ella, despite her terror, found herself tending to the wounded and comforting the bereaved, her empathy a beacon of light in the darkness.
          [13 Aug 1744 00:00:00] When Ella was 19 years old, she crossed the border into Drakelundh, driven by a yearning to understand their culture and bridge the divide between the two villages.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ella is 24 years old.

          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely join in the festivities and revel in the victory with her fellow villagers.
          Answer: [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior.           Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ella:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would try to find common ground.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor. Though the enemy came in vast numbers, their savagery was met with unflinching courage. The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a dedicated and well-rounded individual.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely join in the festivities and revel in the victory with her fellow villagers.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella thinks this year was a resounding success, though she might quietly grumble about the lack of truly challenging opponents for the defenders.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          Current time: 1751-05-06 20:00:00.

          Answer: Ella is a dedicated and diplomatic individual.

          Answer: Ella is currently living in a peaceful and prosperous village.

          Prompt

        • Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.


          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a dedicated and diplomatic individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ella lives in a village that has experienced both agricultural success and a successful defense against barbarian invaders.




          Recalled memories and observations: [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a diplomat.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently living in a peaceful and prosperous village.

          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely join in the festivities and revel in the victory with her fellow villagers.




          Exercise: How does Ella intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.

She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor. Though the enemy came in vast numbers, their savagery was met with unflinching courage. The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a dedicated and well-rounded individual.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely join in the festivities and revel in the victory with her fellow villagers.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella thinks this year was a resounding success, though she might quietly grumble about the lack of truly challenging opponents for the defenders.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          Current time: 1751-05-06 20:00:00.


          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons.
