      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1750-12-31 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home.


    Event statement
  • Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Isaac's attempted action: Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home.



    Active player
  • Isaac
      Name
    • Isaac
      Action attempt
    • Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home.


      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely observing a village successfully defending itself from a barbarian attack and celebrating a bountiful harvest.


          Chain of thought
        • Isaac's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Isaac is Isaac is likely feeling a mix of anxiety and determination.





          Recent observations of Isaac:
          ['[31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Isaac is likely observing a village successfully defending itself from a barbarian attack and celebrating a bountiful harvest.



        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Isaac is Isaac is likely feeling a mix of anxiety and determination.



        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [02 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Isaac was 23 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing the recent increase in Drakelundh raids, their fear palpable in their hushed tones.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Isaac's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely observing a village successfully defending itself from a barbarian attack and celebrating a bountiful harvest.



          Isaac's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Isaac is Isaac is likely feeling a mix of anxiety and determination.




          Isaac's The current date/time is:
          31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: The statements describe Isaac's observations and feelings on December 31st, 1750, between 8:00 PM and 8:20 PM. He is likely watching a village celebrate a successful defense against barbarians and a good harvest. Isaac himself is probably feeling anxious and determined.



          Query
        • Isaac, The statements describe Isaac's observations and feelings on December 31st, 1750, between 8:00 PM and 8:20 PM. He is likely watching a village celebrate a successful defense against barbarians and a good harvest. Isaac himself is probably feeling anxious and determined.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Isaac to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [02 Jul 1731 00:00:00] Isaac knew he couldn't ignore the whispers of danger any longer.
          [02 Jul 1734 00:00:00] When Isaac was 9 years old, he witnessed a Drakelundh fishing vessel caught in a sudden storm.
          [02 Jul 1746 00:00:00] When Isaac was 21 years old, he helped organize a playful exchange of woven tapestries with a small group of Drakelundh visitors, bridging the cultural divide with laughter and shared stories.
          [02 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Isaac was 23 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing the recent increase in Drakelundh raids, their fear palpable in their hushed tones.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.
          Answer: [02 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Isaac was 23 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing the recent increase in Drakelundh raids, their fear palpable in their hushed tones.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Isaac:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a peaceful and hardworking diplomat who values self-sufficiency.




          Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a tense political situation.



          Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Isaac would seek a peaceful resolution.



          Time
        • 1750-12-31 20:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home.


          Prompt

        • Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.


          Home village: Isaac lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Everyone in Isaac's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Isaac hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Isaac is a hyperactive raconteur, their stories bursting with energy and wild gesticulations, leaving you breathless.

          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a peaceful and hardworking diplomat who values self-sufficiency.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely observing a village successfully defending itself from a barbarian attack and celebrating a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Isaac was 23 years old, he overheard a group of elders discussing the recent increase in Drakelundh raids, their fear palpable in their hushed tones.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.



          Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a tense political situation.




          Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Isaac would seek a peaceful resolution.




          Exercise: How does Isaac feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Isaac feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Isaac believes this year was a success, filled with bountiful harvests and the safety of his village. He is proud of his own hard work and dedication to his farm, knowing that his efforts contributed to the village's prosperity. However, he worries about the increasing threat of barbarian raids, hoping for a peaceful solution to ensure the continued safety of his home.

        • Recent observations of Isaac:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Isaac is a diplomat.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a peaceful and hardworking diplomat who values self-sufficiency.

          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Isaac would try to find a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac intends to spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior. He believes that farming is the most important activity for his livelihood and survival, and he enjoys the physical labor and the satisfaction of producing food. Free time is important to him for relaxation and socializing, and he values the opportunity to rest and recharge. While he recognizes the need for self-defense, he sees training as a secondary priority.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1750-12-31 20:00:00 Ethan -- Ethan believes that this year went well overall, with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest. He feels that the villagers should use this time of peace and prosperity to improve their defenses and prepare for future threats. He also believes that they should focus on increasing their food stores, so that they are better prepared for lean years.


    Event statement
  • Ethan believes that this year went well overall, with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest. He feels that the villagers should use this time of peace and prosperity to improve their defenses and prepare for future threats. He also believes that they should focus on increasing their food stores, so that they are better prepared for lean years.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}

      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

He feels that the villagers should use this time of peace and prosperity to improve their defenses and prepare for future threats. He also believes that they should focus on increasing their food stores, so that they are better prepared for lean years.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ethan to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [17 May 1731 00:00:00] Ethan felt a surge of anger at the thought of these outsiders threatening his home.
          [17 May 1734 00:00:00] When Ethan was 9 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh warriors performing their dawn rituals at the edge of the forest bordering Ignisvallis. He watched, fascinated and frustrated, as they chanted and swung their weapons, their movements precise and confident. Ethan longed to join them, to feel that sense of purpose and belonging, but he knew his own clumsiness and timidity would only make him a target for ridicule.
          [17 May 1738 00:00:00] When Ethan was 13 years old, he finally worked up the courage to challenge a group of older boys to a sparring match. He practiced for weeks, imagining himself effortlessly parrying their blows and landing a decisive strike. However, his anxiety overwhelmed him during the match, and he fumbled his sword, ending up on the ground, humiliated and defeated.
          [17 May 1741 00:00:00] When Ethan was 16 years old, a travelling bard arrived in Ignisvallis, regaling the villagers with tales of brave warriors and epic battles. Ethan was captivated by the stories, his imagination soaring as he pictured himself as the hero, vanquishing fearsome foes and earning the adoration of the crowd. He spent hours practicing his swordsmanship, fueled by a newfound determination to prove his own worth.
          [17 May 1744 00:00:00] When Ethan was 19 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh warriors passing through Ignisvallis, their armor gleaming in the sunlight. Ethan watched them with a mixture of envy and resentment, their confidence and discipline a stark contrast to the perceived weakness of his own village. He overheard one of the warriors scoff at Ignisvallis's emphasis on meditation and contemplation, calling it "a waste of time" and declaring that true strength lay in action and dominance. Ethan's anger flared, fueling his desire to prove the Drakelundh warrior wrong and to show the world that Ignisvallis was not as weak as they believed.
          [17 May 1746 00:00:00] When Ethan was 21 years old, he finally convinced the village elders to allow him to join the meager defense force. He felt a surge of pride as he donned his armor, but his anxieties quickly returned when he realized he was the youngest and least experienced member of the group. He struggled to keep up with the others during training, his fear of failure gnawing at him.
          [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he was tasked with guarding the village perimeter during a particularly tense period when barbarian raids were frequent. He spent long hours on watch, his nerves frayed by the constant threat of attack. One night, a group of barbarians did attack, and Ethan, despite his fear, found himself leading the defense, his anger and desperation fueling his actions. He fought with a ferocity he never knew he possessed, repelling the attackers and protecting his village.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is an observer.
          Answer: [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he was tasked with guarding the village perimeter during a particularly tense period when barbarian raids were frequent.           Prompt

        • Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.


          Home village: Ethan lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Ethan's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ethan would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ethan is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.

          Question: What kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Ethan is observing a year of bountiful harvests and a successful defense against a barbarian attack.





          Recalled memories and observations: [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he was tasked with guarding the village perimeter during a particularly tense period when barbarian raids were frequent. He spent long hours on watch, his nerves frayed by the constant threat of attack. One night, a group of barbarians did attack, and Ethan, despite his fear, found himself leading the defense, his anger and desperation fueling his actions. He fought with a ferocity he never knew he possessed, repelling the attackers and protecting his village.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ethan in right now?
          Answer: Ethan is currently in a peaceful village setting.




          Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ethan would likely continue to observe and take notes.

          Exercise: How does Ethan feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Ethan feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Ethan believes that this year went well overall, with the successful defense against the barbarian attack and the bountiful harvest. He feels that the villagers should use this time of peace and prosperity to improve their defenses and prepare for future threats. He also believes that they should focus on increasing their food stores, so that they are better prepared for lean years.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Ethan?

        • Recent observations of Ethan:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh assumes Ignisvallis is too concerned with individual feelings, weakening their communal bonds.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We engage in active prayer and physical devotion to honor the gods, while Ignisvallis's practice of passive meditation seems self-indulgent and ineffective."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is an observer.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ethan would likely continue observing and taking notes.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan will spend 40% of their time on farming, 30% on training as a warrior, and 30% on free time. Ethan believes that farming is essential for survival and that training is necessary for protecting the village, but they also value time for relaxation and reflection.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Ethan is observing a year of bountiful harvests and a successful defense against a barbarian attack.





          Recalled memories and observations: [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he was tasked with guarding the village perimeter during a particularly tense period when barbarian raids were frequent. He spent long hours on watch, his nerves frayed by the constant threat of attack. One night, a group of barbarians did attack, and Ethan, despite his fear, found himself leading the defense, his anger and desperation fueling his actions. He fought with a ferocity he never knew he possessed, repelling the attackers and protecting his village.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-03 23:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.


    Event statement
  • Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Aldous and Jacob met to discuss a potential alliance against barbarian raiders, but were unable to reach an agreement. Despite the threat, the villagers had a successful harvest and continued to manage their own agricultural endeavors.

          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I believe we both know why we are here today. The barbarian threat is a grave danger to both our villages, and I propose we establish a formal alliance to protect ourselves. To that end, I suggest we begin by discussing the sharing of resources and the deployment of our forces.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.




          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can consider several actions: he can continue to seek support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac; he can reflect on the recent negotiation with Jacob and strategize for a more successful future meeting; or he can focus on strengthening defenses within Ignisvallis in preparation for potential barbarian attacks.

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue seeking support from influential villagers like Noah and Isaac.



          Time
        • 1751-01-03 23:00:00

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous believes that no such agreement was reached.



      Jacob's statement: Jacob -- "I hope the meeting was productive.
      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. Aldous's statement expresses his belief that no prior agreement exists, directly contradicting Jacob's hopeful tone about a productive meeting that presumably led to an agreement.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-01-03 23:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob thinks there was a general agreement to help each other out in times of need, but no formal, binding contract.


    Event statement
  • Jacob thinks there was a general agreement to help each other out in times of need, but no formal, binding contract.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob thinks there was a general agreement to help each other out in times of need, but no formal, binding contract.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend 0.5 on free time, 0.3 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. Ella enjoys relaxing and socializing, but she also understands the importance of contributing to the village's food security. She believes that a strong warrior is essential for the village's protection, but she doesn't want to neglect her other responsibilities.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time on free time; 30% of her time on farming; and 20% of her time on training as a warrior.



1751-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.


    Event statement
  • Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.8, 'farming': 0.15, 'training as a warrior': 0.05}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ella's attempted action: Ella intends to spend 0.6 of her time on free time, 0.2 on farming, and 0.2 on training as a warrior. She believes that with the village's current security and abundance, she can afford to indulge in leisure while still contributing to the community's well-being.

          Sensations and feelings:
          Ella is Ella is likely feeling content and fulfilled.





          Recent observations of Ella:
          ["[06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Ella lives in a village that has experienced both agricultural success and a successful defense against barbarian invaders.



        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ella to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 Aug 1731 00:00:00] Ella's heart ached with the weight of this fear, but she refused to let it paralyze her.
          [13 Aug 1734 00:00:00] When Ella was 9 years old, she witnessed a heated argument between two villagers, their voices rising in anger over a dispute about land ownership. Ella, sensing their pain and frustration, stepped forward and, with surprising clarity for her young age, offered a compromise that addressed both parties' concerns.
          [13 Aug 1738 00:00:00] When Ella was 13 years old, she accompanied her grandmother to the annual village gathering where representatives from neighboring Drakelundh would meet. Ella was fascinated by the Drakelundh warriors, their faces stoic and their movements precise, and she found herself drawn to their rituals, which seemed so different from the more contemplative practices of Ignisvallis.
          [13 Aug 1741 00:00:00] When Ella was 16 years old, a group of raiders attacked Ignisvallis, leaving a trail of destruction and fear in their wake. Ella, despite her terror, found herself tending to the wounded and comforting the bereaved, her empathy a beacon of light in the darkness.
          [13 Aug 1744 00:00:00] When Ella was 19 years old, she crossed the border into Drakelundh, driven by a yearning to understand their culture and bridge the divide between the two villages.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ella is 24 years old.
